title: Real Madrid news: Luka Modric keen for Gareth Bale to stay amid claims he wants to leave
text:
Real Madrid midfielder Luka Modric is keen for team-mate Gareth Bale to stay at the club.

Wales international Bale, who has endured a fractious relationship with Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane, reportedly wants to leave the Bernabeu in the summer.

But Modric, who lined up against Bale for Croatia on Sunday, has emphasised his team-mate's importance to the La Liga giants and is eager for him to remain.

Real Madrid midfielder Luka Modric (L) is keen for team-mate Gareth Bale (R) to stay at the club

'He is an amazing player and very important for the team,' Modric said.

'He is showing that this season. Hopefully he will stay this season and the next seasons as well.'

Spanish newspaper AS claimed last week that the 30-year-old winger has had enough and wants to depart in the summer.

Modric and Bale lined up against one another as Croatia faced Wales in Euro 2020 qualifying

Last summer Bale, whose contract does not expire until the summer of 2022, came extremely close to leaving the Bernabeu.

Madrid president Florentino Perez called off Bale's switch to China late on after Zidane had made it clear that the Welshman's time at the club was over.

Bale has made seven appearances for Madrid so far this campaign, in which he has bagged two goals and supplied two assists, but he was left out of the Madrid side for their Champions League clash against Club Bruges last week.
